homes_hear_details: Washington D.C. has launched its HOMES and HEAR rebate programs under the Inflation Reduction Act. The D.C. Department of Energy and Environment (DOEE) is administering the programs in coordination with the DC Sustainable Energy Utility (DCSEU), leveraging existing robust energy efficiency infrastructure.
state_energy_office: District of Columbia Department of Energy and Environment (DOEE)

income_thresholds.low_income_80_ami: For Washington D.C., 80% of Area Median Income for a family of four is approximately $92,800 based on the Washington-Arlington-Alexandria metropolitan area.
income_thresholds.moderate_income_150_ami: For Washington D.C., 150% of Area Median Income for a family of four is approximately $174,000 based on the Washington-Arlington-Alexandria metropolitan area.

net_metering: Washington D.C. has strong net metering for systems up to 1 MW. Customers receive credit at the full retail rate for excess generation. D.C. also has a Renewable Portfolio Standard requiring 100% renewable energy by 2032 and a Solar Renewable Energy Credit (SREC) market that provides additional compensation for solar generation.

state_tax_credits.name: D.C. Property Tax Exemption for Renewable Energy
state_tax_credits.amount: 5-year property tax exemption for the added value of qualifying renewable energy improvements
state_tax_credits.eligible_items: Solar photovoltaic systems, solar thermal systems, and other qualifying renewable energy installations
state_tax_credits.details: D.C. provides a temporary property tax exemption for the increased property value attributable to renewable energy systems.

state_rebate_programs.name: DC Sustainable Energy Utility (DCSEU) Residential Programs
state_rebate_programs.administrator: DCSEU (operated by Vermont Energy Investment Corporation - VEIC)
state_rebate_programs.amount: Up to $2,500 for heat pumps, up to $3,500 for weatherization, $300-$750 for heat pump water heaters, $50-$200 for ENERGY STAR appliances
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Heat pumps (ductless and ducted), insulation, air sealing, heat pump water heaters, smart thermostats, ENERGY STAR appliances, LED lighting
state_rebate_programs.details: The DCSEU is D.C.'s energy efficiency utility, providing rebates, technical assistance, and financing for energy efficiency improvements. Enhanced incentives are available for income-qualifying households. Funded by the Sustainable Energy Trust Fund.

state_rebate_programs.name: Solar for All
state_rebate_programs.amount: Free solar installation for income-qualifying households; estimated savings of $500+ per year on electricity bills
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Residential rooftop solar PV or community solar subscriptions for low-to-moderate income households
state_rebate_programs.details: D.C.'s Solar for All program provides free solar energy to income-qualifying D.C. residents, with a goal of reducing energy bills by at least 50% for 100,000 low-income households by 2032.

state_rebate_programs.name: Weatherization Assistance Program
state_rebate_programs.administrator: District of Columbia Department of Energy and Environment (DOEE)
state_rebate_programs.amount: Average expenditure of approximately $8,000 per home
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Insulation, air sealing, heating/cooling system repair or replacement, windows, doors, health and safety improvements
state_rebate_programs.details: Federally funded program for income-qualifying households at or below 200% of federal poverty level.

programs.name: Pepco Residential Energy Savings Rebates
programs.amount: Up to $1,500 for heat pumps, $500 for insulation, $200 for smart thermostats, $100-$300 for ENERGY STAR appliances
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency heat pumps, central air conditioners, insulation, air sealing, smart thermostats, ENERGY STAR appliances, heat pump water heaters

programs.name: Pepco Home Energy Assessment
programs.amount: Free or reduced-cost ($50) comprehensive home energy assessment with direct-install measures
programs.eligible_items: Home energy audit including free LED bulbs, smart power strips, water-saving devices, and personalized energy-saving recommendations

programs.name: Pepco Income-Qualified Efficiency Programs
programs.amount: Free energy efficiency improvements for income-qualifying customers (full cost covered)
programs.eligible_items: Complete home energy efficiency improvements including insulation, HVAC, appliance replacement, lighting for income-qualifying households

programs.name: Washington Gas Residential Rebates
programs.amount: Up to $500 for high-efficiency furnaces, $300 for water heaters, $50 for smart thermostats
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency natural gas furnaces, boilers, tankless water heaters, smart thermostats
